intro: Malvastrum uniapiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-awned mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and are covered in fine hairs. It is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
